intro: Colea bernieri, commonly known as the St. Helena cormflower, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively on the island of St. Helena in the South Atlantic Ocean. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae, characterized by its tuberous corms and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the unique climate of its island habitat. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered critically endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
